Question_1.Context: The study focused on optimizing the conditions for the biotransformation of hemin into biliverdin using recombinant P. pastoris GS115-HO1 cells.
Question_1.Question: What was the optimal pH of the BMMY medium for the expression of HO1?
Question_1.Source: The optimal expression conditions were obtained as follows: BMMY medium with a pH of 6.0...

Question_2.Context: The study investigated the impact of different inducer concentrations on the expression of HO1.
Question_2.Question: What was the optimal concentration of the inducer methanol for the expression of HO1?
Question_2.Source: The optimal expression conditions were obtained as follows: ...addition of 1% methanol...

Question_3.Context: The study explored the effect of sorbitol addition on the expression of HO1.
Question_3.Question: What was the optimal molar ratio of sorbitol to methanol for the expression of HO1?
Question_3.Source: The optimal expression conditions were obtained as follows: ...a 2.5% molar ratio of sorbitol to methanol...

Question_4.Context: The study investigated the impact of the duration of the induction period on the expression of HO1.
Question_4.Question: What was the optimal duration of the induction period for the expression of HO1?
Question_4.Source: The optimal expression conditions were obtained as follows: ...The induction process was conducted for 3 days...

Question_5.Context: The study focused on optimizing the conditions for the biotransformation of hemin into biliverdin using recombinant P. pastoris GS115-HO1 cells.
Question_5.Question: What was the optimal time for the biotransformation of hemin into biliverdin?
Question_5.Source: The optimal biotransformation time was 4 hours, resulting in an enzyme activity of 0.560 U/mL in the GS115-HO1 culture.

Question_6.Context: The study explored the impact of different solvents on the biotransformation of hemin into biliverdin.
Question_6.Question: Which solvent yielded the highest conversion yield of biliverdin?
Question_6.Source: The conversion yield of biliverdin was highest when 0.05 mol/L NaOH aqueous solution was used as the solvent...

Question_7.Context: The study investigated the impact of different hemin concentrations on the biotransformation of hemin into biliverdin.
Question_7.Question: What was the conversion yield of biliverdin when the hemin concentration was 0.8 g/L?
Question_7.Source: When the concentration of hemin reached 0.8 g/L or above, the concentration of biliverdin remained almost constant at 132 mg/L, resulting in a conversion yield of 18.5% at 0.8 g/L hemin.

Question_8.Context: The study aimed to optimize the conditions for the biotransformation of hemin into biliverdin using recombinant P. pastoris GS115-HO1 cells.
Question_8.Question: What was the concentration of biliverdin in the mixture when the substrate hemin concentration was 0.05 g/L?
Question_8.Source: Even when the substrate hemin concentration was as low as 0.05 g/L, the conversion yield of biliverdin was only 48.7%, and the concentration of biliverdin in the mixture was 21.9 mg/L.

Question_9.Context: The study focused on optimizing the conditions for the biotransformation of hemin into biliverdin using recombinant P. pastoris GS115-HO1 cells.
Question_9.Question: What was the conversion yield of biliverdin when the biotransformation time was 6 hours?
Question_9.Source: The conversion yield of biliverdin was highest when 0.05 mol/L NaOH aqueous solution was used as the solvent...

Question_10.Question: What was the enzyme activity in the culture of the GS115-HO1 after the optimization process?
